document.masterDocTitle: Redescription of Ameroseius eumorphus Bregetova (Acari: Mesostigmata: Ameroseiidae), a new record of Epicriopsis Berlese from Iran and a new homonym in Ameroseiidae

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Redescription of Ameroseius eumorphus Bregetova (Acari: Mesostigmata: Ameroseiidae), a new record of Epicriopsis Berlese from Iran and a new homonym in Ameroseiidae

bibRefCitation.author: Bregetova N. G.
bibRefCitation.refString: Bregetova N. G. 1977 - Family Ameroseiidae (Berlese, 1919) Evans, 1961. In: Ghilyarov MS, Bregetova NG (Eds.), A key to the soil inhabiting mites. Mesostigmata - p. 148 - 169. (Akademia Nauka: Leningrad).

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis — Palp tarsal claws and corniculi two and three tined respectively; setae h1 about twice thicker than h2 and h3; fixed cheliceral digit with four large teeth near the base of digit and subapical offset gabelzahn. Dorsal shield with 28 pairs of lanceolate setae and very slightly serrate (j1 leafshaped), tips of J2 and J4 do not reach the base of J4 and Z5, respectively. Opisthogasteric region with 6 pairs of setae, 2 of which on the ventri-anal shield (in addition to circumanal setae). Ventri-anal shield wider than long, anterior margin with clearly depression, pre-anal setae (Jv2) set closed together.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Remarks — According to Evans 1963 (p. 300) adult female of Ameroseiidae have 9 setae on tibia IV: 2-2/1-2/1-1. This is different from what was observed for
Ameroseius potchefstroomensis ( Kruger and Loots, 1980 )
and
A. mineiro
Narita et al. , 2013
(presence of pl2). According to our observations on 30 specimens of
A. eumorphus
, it revealed that this situation (the presence of pl2) also is correct for this species.

Narita et al. (2013)
considered
plumosus
speciesgroup includes 8 species. This species group has the following features: dorsal shield reticulate and without pit-like depressions; with 28 pairs of setae, exceptionally 26 pairs (for
Ameroseius dipankari Bhattacharyya, 2004
); dorsal setae are lanceolate to leaf-shaped, also opisthogastric region with 5-6 pairs of setae, which 2 pairs are located on ventrianal shield.

subSubSection.paragraph:
One species of this group is
A. eumorphus
which is similar to
Ameroseius mineiro
,
A. wahabi ( Ibrahim and Abdel-Samed, 1999 )
,
A. parplumosus ( Nasr and Abou-Awad, 1986 )
,
A. potchefstroomensis ,
A. plumosus ( Oudemans, 1902 )
and
A. pseudoplumosus Rack, 1972
. To compare
A. eumorphus
with similar species, several important taxonomic characters were considered and comparison between them is shown in Table 1 .

Distribution, habitat and host of
A. eumorphus
— The distribution, habitat and host of
A. eumorphus
are presented in Table 2 .

Type deposition — Collection of the Zoological Institute of the Academy of Sciences of the USSR , Leningrad
.
